Description: Lower body sherd of Chian pottery mug; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: black hook maeander frieze between pairs of black (fired partly brown) bands; wide band around base of wall; underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.499.i (with a more pronounced base). According to Williams' typology (1983, 178), the mug fits into his Type A and into Boardman's (1967,126) Type B. Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1926) (phase 2)
